text: Which inner resource surprised you most with its strength during that difficult time?
How did that struggle reshape or redefine your sense of purpose in life?
Is there a scar from that experience that still aches, and what helps to heal it?
Was there a moment you felt close to giving up? What ultimately kept you going?
In what ways did your relationships with others change as a result of this experience?
What did you learn about human kindness, or perhaps its opposite, through this adversity?
Share one thing you wish others truly understood about what you went through.
How has your definition or perception of 'strength' evolved since then?
Can you recall any small victories or moments of light you clung to during the struggle?
Did your perspective on life's priorities undergo a dramatic shift due to this adversity?
What role did hope play in your journey? How did you nurture or maintain it?
Is there a piece of advice you received during that time that genuinely helped you?
How do you practice self-compassion when reflecting on that challenging period?
Did you find any unexpected beauty or profound lessons hidden within the darkness?
In what positive ways has this adversity shaped the person you are today?
What practices or boundaries do you now implement to protect your peace or well-being?
If you could speak to yourself at the very beginning of that struggle, what would you say?
In the context of this experience, what does 'healing' truly mean to you?
Looking back, what are you most grateful for having come through that experience?
How has this experience influenced your capacity for empathy towards others?
